author: A_Brickset_user
review: After I got both LEGO Island games, I really needed a Pepper. Well, TLC came out with these horribly bad-deal, good minifgure stunt sets. Pepper is a pretty good minifig, and adding a skateboarder to your town is a good idea, so I recommend this set for a reasonable price to Town collectors.

author: hustla187
title: Enjoyed This One
review: I remember getting this in the mail and it looked very good. I liked the little ramp which was very cool. The skateboard was very cool and and made this set fun to play. Also, you get Pepper and this set is perfect and has no flaws.

author: Zapp_Brannigan
title: Small
review: This set comes with Pepper, skateboard, ramp, railing, and stick that allows you to attach to Pepper to perform whatever trick he wants. I mean, make him launch off the ramp and into outer space! The possibilites are endless. Overall nice little set, endless fun and excitement.

author: CrzyLCF
title: It's Pepper-Tastic!
review: For a really small set, there is no way to explain it as simply stunning. This set comes with Pepper who is really well designed with drenched red hair and pizza imprinted on his legs and torso. He also has a light gray stick attached to his back which is meant to be used for doing numerous stunts off the dark gray ramp on his slick yellow skateboard. I have no complaints whatsoever about this set as it is just Pepper-Tastic! Get it if you can because you won't regret it one bit!

author: Berrus_Brickus
title: Name: Pepper Roni, Occupation: The dude with the food- LEGO Island 2
review:
Like Brickster's Trike, not much to it.  On to the review-

 

  • Pros:
  • *Pepper
  • *Skate Board (can never have to many)
  • *Green Backpack, nice representation from LI2 and IXS video games
  • *Grey stick attached to backpack allows tricks to be manuevered
  • *Goes well with the Skate Park

 

  • Cons:
  • *Trick stick should be transparent
  • *Could of used a pizza
  • *Not a very good stand alone set
